alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 2:41AM MST until February 18 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with snowfall rates 0.50 to 1" per hour possible 1pm through 5pm. Winds gusting 15 to 20 mph could blow snow greatly reducing visibility at times, mainly at Lookout Pass. * WHERE...Lookout Pass, Evaro Hill and Lower Clark Fork Region. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 7 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
